meanings.definition: A person who trains others in criminal activities.
meanings.sent1: The fagin taught the young thieves how to pick pockets.
meanings.sent2: The notorious fagin was known for his ability to mentor aspiring criminals.
meanings.sent3: The fagin jokingly referred to himself as the 'master of mischief'.
meanings.sent4: In the underworld, he was seen as the fagin, molding minds into cunning crooks.
meanings.sent5: The fagin's influence on the criminal world was undeniable.

meanings.sent3: The group planned to fagin their newest member in the ways of the underworld.
meanings.sent4: His ability to fagin others made him a sought-after mentor among thieves.
meanings.sent5: She fagined him well, and soon he was a skilled pickpocket.
